description: i recently update my fedora 28 to 29 and install simplenote form software and it doesn't work any more
Excellent cross platform alternative to evernote

I've searched for a long time for a truly cross-platform notes app. This is it. I've been using it for almost a year. I've synced hundreds of notes.  It's one of my most indispendible apps. Works flawlessly on all linux distros, android, ios, windows. Automatically syncs, is searchable. Lacks some formatting features, but this is part of its charm. It function just as its name suggests; its a no nonsense simple notes app that gets the job done.
Use it everyday.

- I've got it installed on Linux, macOS and iOS
- Automatically syncs my notes across all my OSs
- Markdown-formatting makes it very flexible in structuring notes (e.g. headings, tables, checklists, code highlighting, keyboard shortcuts highlighting, etc)
- Can choose light or dark theme

Very satisfied with it. No major complaints from me. Has become my default note-taking app. If you're looking for a note-taking app that does all you expect of a modern note-taking app (syncing across devices, formatting) which is as cross-platform as can be, this is your best choice.
Does the essential things and does it well. Best cross platform notetaking app AFAIK.

I would prefer a more visual markdown editing experience such as in Bear Notes or a two pane view. Switching to a preview and back is not a good solution. 

Its great to have a free service, but there is NO PRIVACY: "In terms of security, Simplenote works a lot like other popular online services such as Gmail and Facebook. Your personal information is protected by a strict Privacy Policy. But due to the need for searching your notes from the web, the contents must remain unencrypted while in storage so the software can find your search terms." (from https://simplenote.com/help/)

The information in your notes is about as public as anything stored in Facebook, which might be OK for preparing your blog posts, but not for private medical data.
summary: Very basic markdown features, lacking in privacy and security

description: A great app for sharing lines of text and other infortmation between my Lubuntu laptop, Windows PC and Android phone. Works perfect for me.

no Problems with it
with simplenote you're able to write notes and synchronize them with other devices
after I complete installiation,I can not launch it and have no any error message
It works well but it is impossible add pictures.... still very far from evernote
summary: It is fine but needs a lot of improvements

description: Given the hype I thought I'd try it out. It is developed by the same people who develop Wordpress so comes with some standing and reputation. However, after the app was installed on my Ubuntu Gnome 18.04 desktop, you are given an option to login with a Wordpress.com account, which I have. The login does not progress with the 'authorizing' action seemingly stuck in it's process. I tried other ways including creating a new non-Wordpress account, no luck there either. This bug is known to devs. I've uninstalled.
summary: Bug - couldn't sign in / sign up - app got stuck

description:
Snap works great with default themes, but since I'm using communitheme snap (https://snapcraft.io/communitheme), when I launch the app it'll use white menu background as it's color. 

A problem which has been fixed as part of Electron upstream but is still present here (https://github.com/ubuntu/yaru/issues/715).

Please fix this problem and this snap will be 5/5.
Perfect!Perfect!Perfect!
Simple and easy~

I use notes apps for logging my to-do lists. I therefore don't need a notes app with lots of bells and whistles.

This app is perfect because it is lightweight, syncs quickly and offers cross-platform functionality on both my Ubuntu machine and iPhone.
It's the best, most concise, app I've used so far, for notetaking. However it takes far too long for it to launch when you are running processor heavy apps.
One of the Best cross platform syncing note taking app ever.
I logged into gmail through Wordpress pop up, and pressed the Authorizing button and waited like an idiot. Please fix this bug
summary: Could not log into it with my Wordpress account

description: Have been using Simplenote for years and am very happy with it. I normally install as a DEB package but as my old package was outdated I tried installing the latest version via Snap. The new version installed and works as usual except the Simplenote icon does not show up on the launcher, just a generic black box with a red circle in it is all and that only shows if I open the program. This has happened before when using Snap and I may have to once again install via DEB in order to have the icon display.
